name: Transmissions: Element 120
description: TE120 is a short single player experience set in the Half-Life Universe featuring a gravity defying weapon that allows you to jump buildings and sustain large falls. The story takes place at a mysterious date & location. Where are you? Why have you been sent?
minimum_requirements: OS: WindowsÂ® 10/8/7 32/64-bit / Vista 32/64 / XP Processor: Pentium 4 3.0GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Video card with 128 MB, Shader model 2.0. ATI X800, NVidia 6600 or better DirectX: Version 8.1 Storage: 4 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 8.1 compatible sound card
recommended_requirements: OS: WindowsÂ® 10/8/7 32/64-bit / Vista 32/64 / XP Processor: Intel core 2 duo 2.4GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Video Card Shader model 3.0. NVidia 7600, ATI X1600 or better DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 4 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 8.1 compatible sound card

reviews.review_text: THE DOWNLOW:  Transmissions: Element 120 is a Source engine developed indie game set in the Half-Life universe. It consists of four well-made if somewhat short chapters that provide a few encounters with your favourite crab-zombies and combine soldiers. The overall feel and setting is designed to be a mixture of horror and puzzle solving, with a little hint of combat at key moments.   THE GOOD:  + More Half-Life style play. + Great care and attention to create an immersive environment and detailed locations, take this small team's effort a step up. + The custom made soundtrack elevates the tension and key encounters to another level. + Loved the clever use of luminescent paint in certain areas. + Its short and can be played in two to three hours. + Achievements are simple to obtain but can be missed if not careful. + Its free.   THE BAD:  - Not much really. If anything there could have been a little more spoken narrative / dialogue included to help build up a better picture of the scenario. - Some of the AI routines stop working for combine soldiers and they just stand there doing nothing. Happened a few times. - Progressing through some of the physics-based doorways/exits can be confusing. So if thats not your thing make sure you are happy to consult a guide.   AND THE ORDINARY:  * The engine may be dated but the developers have maxxed out as much as possible with the tools they have to make this more than just a mod. * There isnt much combat with it being staged in key set-pieces towards the end of chapters.    VERDICT:  Short, well-made but enjoyable nonetheless. If you are waiting for Half-life (Episode) 3 you could do worse than check this out! Its one of the best free-to-play efforts that you are bound to find on steam. Fans of Half-life should enjoy this no question. Otherwise if you are after easy/quick achievements or just like to pass the time with free games then you would be a fool not to try this. If however you are after a pure or heavy-focused shooter then this is not for you.
Half Life 3 is a great game.
Valve quality stuff right here, and for the low price of $0.00 you have nothing to complain about, simply magnificent.

MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS  So I just played through Transmissions: Element 120 and oh god.  If you like HL2 then this is for you. If you want something with good atmosphere then I recommend this.  The story is short, but solid. You wake up in a train cart, and from there you proceed to find the remains of what seems to be a Rebel outpost. The further you go into it all the less you will understand, until you find a note left behind by what you can only assume is a dead rebel. From there you continue on and end up in a lab. There you find what looks like a Gravity Gun but it is very different. There you will also find a note explaining that they had been experimenting with what seemed to be named Element 120.  I will not list a pros and cons because I can only think of one thing that would be a con, and that's how short the mod is.  It does a great job to create an excellent atmosphere and fun gameplay. The level design is amazing too.  8/10 - Just wish it was longer.

It may only be an hour of gameplay, but this awesome mod packs a real punch... There are some amazing moments, which I won't go into detail about here, but suffice it to say it holds up to some of the best set pieces from the Half Life 2 episodes. And it really is best played in the dark for maximum effect...

Transmissions: Element 120  It's a good game. It has the same physics and mechanics of Portal series and Garry's mod (From Half Life 2).   It started out as a horror game until you find the Gravity gun,, thing  . Then you blow sh*t out of everything in the game.  8/10 - It's fun and sometimes hillarious !
Short yet lovely experience.
An intresting new story involving the half life universe! I tottaly recomend playing this game, it's a nice experience! Plus it's free, why not? P.S. Around 2-2,5 hours for 100%
Great Game i really loved it
Nice little Half Life Game!

For 'new school' gamers this is definitelly good start to view older games as better ones in some ways. This game is not ported and is better BECAUSE of it. Too similar to Half Life on which engine it runs.   Takes only 1 or 2 hours to finish. For todays standart not very easy, but definitelly not hard.   As it is free I recommend it for anyone. And if you do not anyhow know what to do, just take bigger picture of situation. Take your time and finish it :-).
I loved this mod. Even though it was a bit short, the new gameplay was awesome, the music was spot on, I loved every bit of this mod, and I'd definitely play more of this! Strongly recommended.
It's like an unofficial Half Life demo. Use your brain and shoot some brains out. Definitely worth to play this short game.

This is a really great free game in the Half-Life universe. You do some puzzles and fight a bunch of enemies. Even if you don't know anything about half life this is still fun. Also all of the achievements are fairly easy and fun to get.
Decent but short. If you enjoy playing single player Half-Life 2 mods, give this game a shot.
A brilliant concept for the Half-Life universe with extremely cool mechanics. It's a game that leaves you wanting more.

10/10 i highly recamend if you have the time to play i got stuck at the striders but im pretty sure i and the rest of you can get past them.also i wish i had the 'element 120' in gmod also if the creator is seeing this please make more like this

I'm always looking for more Half Life 2. It's one of the very first PC games I played and it has been in a special place in my heart ever since. Valve was a pioneer in the first person shooter genre in both puzzling and shooting baddies. Transmissions expands on the design and fun of Half Life 2, if only briefly, in ways I never thought could be done. For example, right off at the start of the game, you wake on a train, much like the rest. In total darkness, you are unsure what to do until the game cracks the door and light spills in to show you what to do. There were no tooltips, the set was designed to show you what to do. These sets are also stunning in the graphics themselves. The textures are a lot more high res, the lights have bloom, and other post processing effects make it more immersive than Source games before it.   After you leave the opening sequence, you amass an arsenal in true Half Life fashion. But you also get introduced to game mechanics unique to Transmissions. 'The breathless can't see in the dark'. With glow in the dark paint and QR codes that can be decoded by zooming in left by an unknown helper, you discover that the absence of light switches the AI of the zombies and turrets off. It's more of a puzzle element than a stealth element, but being able to switch out the lights to sneak around is an interesting puzzle to add to the game. The last bit of gameplay is another repurposed Gravity Gun. In this game, it's a dedicated rocket jump. It's very simple and fun to use.  The only downside to this amazing game is the length. I finished it in a half hour, and while you can replay it for the rest of the achievements, I was left hungry for more. If the developer is reading this, make more. I will pay for it.

Game   : Transmissions: Element 120   Score   : 8/10    TL:DR   : A great little experience if you're a fan of the Half-life series, although the brief length of the game hinders the full potential of all the elements and new ideas the game brings to the table.    Summary   : Let me first say, the game certainly was a great addition to the source engine's vast library of success. It utilized all of its assets and created an experience that was well worth enjoying. Power to the developer for making such an interesting little mod for a near-forgotten universe. Although, I'd like to give (hopefully) constructive criticisms where I see them fit.    Lack of Continuity   - What I mean when I say this is, you are presented on multiple occasions with an interesting new mechanic that aids in solving a couple of puzzles, though thereafter it's merely tossed to the wind. A primary example of this is manuevering in the dark amidst zombies. There was so much potential for further utilizing this type of puzzle, though after only a one time use it was never used again at any point in the game.    In fact, thereafter players were instead greeted with an onslaught of zombies. While still a fun encounter, it only further fuels my point.    The gravity gun in many respects also falls under this critique, as it had the potential for so much more, yet met its peak of use mere moments after having acquired it.    Little Story Development   - Aside from recognizing that you are in a city infested with zombies and that there are combine soldiers patrolling the streets, there isn't much to tell. While there are notes that further elaborate on the situation, they too left me wondering 'What happens next?'. It's good to have ambiguity in stories such as these, though without any form of revelation, I feel as if the premise falls flat.  But, aside from my opinions, the game itself is certainly a more than enjoyable experience if you're looking to kill an hour or two. So, with that said, I would definitely recommend picking this little diddy up!

A seriously awesome game, my first playthrough it really felt like I could sort of choose which alley to go down, or that I was actually in a world instead of some linear pathway shooting gallery. The battles are lots of fun with many unique ways of killing the alien freaks that come after you, just as good if not better than any half life game I've played~
Aside from some bugs here and there, some confusing areas and low FPS here and there, it was enjoyable. If you have an hour to spare, this game is pretty good.
If one guy made this, try to imagine if he worked at valve with an entire team.
Great little mod with a bit of story. Nicely put together. Love the darker look of HL2!
Gabe, Valve, still don't want to release/create half-life 3? Thats okay, from now on we know that not only you can make it, great as others hls.  Fear it.

A short, but exciting expansion pack that is totally free! While not much is explained during the story it is clear that we join the rebels and support them in their fight against the Combine. Journals and QR codes scattered across the 4 chapters shed some light on the story.  The new addition to this game is the unique gravity gun we are provided with. Instead of being able to pull objects from a distance the gravity gun now launches an energy orb - similar to the secondary fire mode of the Pulse Rifle - that destroys everything in its path. It uses our auxiliary power so whilst it is practically a weapon with infinite ammo we have to wait until it charges.   Not only that but shooting underneath us propels our hero up the air. Call it Half Life's version of Quake's good-old rocketjump! This allows us to reach higher spots and helps us with maneuvering against the striders in the endgame.  The only downside with Transmissions is that it's terribly short. It could have used a couple of more levels with the inclusion of other enemies from the franchise such as more Combine soldiers or some Hunters. In any case, this is a must for Half Life fans!
Great game! It's based off Half Life 2's models.
Cool concept. Would recommend downloading and playing through. Took me about an hour to finish.
Short but nice. Puzzels are not hard, although I did not had pationace and checked the walkthrough. Play time is about 1 hour.

A fun little mod for sure, and at just a single hour's length it isn't a big time investment at all to try out, with an atmospheric first half and a bombastic combat-focused second half with a unique modified weapon. I suffered one crash during my playthrough, but luckily the autosaves are frequent. The mod includes achievements, so while it is short, there are a few challenges to increase replay value for those who want to play it a second or third time. I would say just go play it and judge for yourself due to it's short length - as such the remainder of the review contains some gameplay spoilers:  The unique element of the mod is a gravity gun that fires exploding energy balls, and can be used to rocket jump by firing below you as you jump. It was a fun mechanic, but it felt a bit underused. There are just a couple of arbitrary moments where you are forced to use it to reach a high ledge, but in combat it is seemingly optional, since the game kits you out with pretty much the entire gallery of weapons from Half-Life 2. Ammo is a little scarce, but not entirely, making the game feel like it sends mixed messages a little. On the flipside it does mean you can play with either the new weapon or have a more traditional Half-Life experience, but it does mean neither option is particularly tightly designed. You also don't get the modified Gravity Gun until about halfway through the game, which was a surprising factor considering it's the mod's selling point. It feels like the guns are there as a get out of jail free card for when the gravity gun runs out of charge, but I'd rather it retained it's standard close-range jolt to stun enemies, so you can run away and recover - perhaps make it so this mechanic also allows for long jumps for retreats without causing damage to enemies.  The first chapter was nicely designed with the darkness providing some neat gimmicks. I'd be lying if I said I didn't have to really work up the courage to descend into the pit of zombies, despite being well-familiar with them from multiple Half-Life 2 playthroughs over the years. The crescendo at the end of the third chapter felt more fun and exciting to use the new Gravity Gun, with tons of toys and traps to manipulate with it to wreck hordes of zombies. Meanwhile the fourth chapter's finale encounter felt like the epitome of my 'mixed messages' criticism, where rather than being used creatively for combat, the gravity gun instead is just a means to get around and collect a finite amount of rockets to take out Striders in a very traditional manner. While two cranes can be shot to drop shipping containers on the Striders for a very satisfying payoff, once both those chances are used up, that's the end of the only creative idea the finale has.  Overall, I feel if this mod is intended to serve as a proof of concept for this gravity gun idea, it has succeeded very well, the idea has great potential. I just wish the mod was overall more focused and tightly designed around it, I'm sure some more creative things could be done and the reliance on showering the player with typical Half-Life weapons could be axed. If however, the mod is just meant to be what it is, it still succeeds at being a pleasurable experience from start to finish.

I have played lots of half life 'mods' this one, it brung back memories. half life was the first cp game i ever played and i have been waiting for something to be atleast a fifth of the caliber. and this is it
Short, sweet, and free. More from this author, please!

YES DO RECOMEND JUST FINISHED AMAZING GAMEPLAY AND DESIGN YES GO DOWNLOAD RIGHT NOW  In all seriousness though, this was awesome. It's a very short game but that shortness is packed with awesome mechanics and interaction. Pacing was nice. Visuals were top notch. Level design was excellent. I want more. MORE.  GIVE ME MORE  SCREW HL3 GIVE ME THE SEQUEL OF THIS

Another amazing spin-off game for the half life series. it has great atmosphere, the special weapon created for the game is really creative and useful, and the graphics still look decent for an engine that is starting to show its age. the game even has an amazing stealth feature which is something i have not seen in any previous half life related game to date.  but the one problem i have with the game of course is the length. it could have been a little longer plus the ending is a little weak and rushed. but i still recommend playing it for its atmosphere and creative gameplay.

TL;DR: It's short, but so damn good.  If you've played any of the half life games, you'll feel right at home with this. Transmissions: Element 120 feels like it could be Half Life 3, which definitely wasn't what I was expecting going into this. The core gameplay mechanic is incredibly fun to use, and have lots of potential uses. I would suggest anyone that's a fan of the half life series to play this.

Although short, the game has a lot of interesting sequences, especially the way you can use the 'darkness' to conceal yourself; and getting environmental kills with the 'Gravity Concussion' gun is great
Love it! Especially that it's like playing an extra level from hl2! You did a great work!  Please create more!

Short but very detailed. Delves into some of the lesser-explored mechanics of the original Half-Life 2 game as well as giving you a new gun with a totally different use from anything seen in Half Life or even Portal.  The last level is a bit hard but once you get used to using the new gun you will eventually get past it.  Overall, I highly recommend this game for those who have played Half-Life games or those who are new to the franchise but still have experience in variable-pace first person shooters.
An excellent (but short) Half-Life experience

Great game ! It is uncommon to see a hl2 mod full fledged and well polished like this. The gameplay isn't complicated but it's really fun to carry out. Flyin' across the building + Shooting combine is never out of date. But it's not perfect. That zombie scene, when I thought it's great time to test out my aim, from almost 800 hours in hl2dm, it lag so hard. Maybe it is just unrealistic to put so many zombies active in one scene. This level needs some serious optimization. If the game is 3x longer it can potentially be the hl2 ep3 lel ~_~
Short but well done Mod.  Recommend playing this since its free.
Well designed; short sweet and to the point!
It may be short, but the quality of work show in this mod makes up for that. It is also a rocket jumping simulator, so who would hate that?

A very unique, fun to play, well designed shorty story of a game. Unique, fairly tense atmosphere, some old-school style platforming and boss fights, and a fun movement mechanic combine to give you a great thirty to sixty minutes of playtime.
As they say, short but sweet!. Definitely worth trying out! Really good HL mod, the only thing i found bad was the length of the game.
awsome if your a guy who like hl2
7.8/10 too much water
MORE!!! This was truely an amazing experience. The take on the gravity gun was really fun to use. I honestly hope to see more like this in the future!
Really cool game, Wish there was more.

This is nothing short of brilliant and left me wishing that it was much, much longer. What a fabulous and highly-professional piece of work this guy has created. All credit to him for his talent and skill.  Get it!

Transmissions: Element 120  is a short single-player experience, where you play as Gordon Freeman [obviously] from the original Half-Life series. You are not given any objective from the start, you don't know where you are and where to go. All of this creates an unforgettable, dark and immersive atmosphere.   The game looks beautiful, the new, redesigned source engine is just a joy to look at. The gameplay introduces a few new game mechanics, such as zombies can't see in the dark, so you have to keep your flashligh off while avoiding zombies in a pitch black darkness. Also, you are given a new weapon - a reconstructed gravity gun [Element 120], which shoots out energy orbs, killing instantly everything that's in its way. I don't have to tell you, that it is incredibly fun to play with.  Since the game is not very long, there aren't many action scenes. There are only two big action sequences, both of them at the very end. But when you experience them, you will want more! They are perfectly choreographed, with adrenalin-pumping music and lots of ways to dispatch your enemies. It's evident that a lot of care went into designing these scenes, but it's a shame that the best parts are only at the end.  The only criticism I have is the lack of guidance. There are a few rooms you will get stuck at, trying to figure out what are you supposed to do and where to go. There are moments when you have to use your new gravity gun to blast open barricaded doors or just jump through something, however, they aren't indicated very well, often just blending in with background.   PROS'n'CONS:  + fast and enjoyable gameplay + immersive atmosphere [play this at night with lights off!] + fun action sequences + music + sound design + free to play  - too short [one hour to complete the story + 20 minutes to get achievements] - lack of guidance/tutorial   OVERALL:  It is a nice, albeit short, one hour experience, but incredibly fun. And hey,  it's F2P  so why not give it a go?

I came in to this mod unsure of what to expect as it had high reviews but was said it would be short. But I found the mod was nicely put together with some new mechanics that make this short foray back in to the half-life universe more memorable. It was ahtmospheric welly made almost as if valve themselves made it. The mod alone is worth a donation equal to the price of an official expansion but the charity donations goal make it almost a must. I had no issues eveything worked and I had a little fun and would recomend at the very least giving it a try. Still it has some nice ideas and its always fun to play hl2 again so thanks for that. Plus, its free so you can't beat that right.

Really good mod. Lil'bit short. 4/5

fun if you like hl2 you need to play dis game i recommend it to you :)

Very short game, but what sticks out is that it uses very interesting concepts to help drive the gameplay. For example, most NPCs wont be able to spot you in the dark unless you have your flashlight on. You can also use the flashlight to have sentries target whatever NPC you flash the light on, and unless you're looking at the sentry with the flashlight, it won't shoot you.  It's short. It's free. Why not?

Amazing game, reminds me butiful days of Half-Life 2, the new gun is verry powerful, I recomend it, and I hope the developers will make more games based on this engine and this tematics! Thank you for making it free!

Exelent game. Short, but good.
It's short, but so incredibly well done! The final level is beyond what I had hoped for. If you've even just casually played the Half-Life series games before, you definitely want to pck this up!

Starts off as an intriguing horror game using elements such as the light to alter the A.I between turrets and zombies until you get the jump gun which turns the game into a breeze. Guns become pointless as the jump gun one shots both zombies and combine whilst having an area of effect damage.  The final battle is very well done as striders use their cannon to shoot holes through all of the buildings and crouch to shoot you through the holes, my only two complaints are that striders cant shoot you on most of the roofs and that it gets tedious when you have to constantly jump around the map searching for rocket launcher ammo (which always comes with health) instead of having the ability to use creative means to kill the striders, other than two shipping containers which have a ridiculous delay on dropping and the fact that the game just adds more striders in the same number at the same time with a few combines adds no tension or desperation when the game doesnt try to add another type of danger which could possibly counter your jump gun, such as a chopper or the striders destroying structures completely.
Pros: Cool atmosphere, great idea.   Cons: Poor optimization, very short (ive finished it in about 50 minutes)  Conclusion: Try it, but don't expect too much, nothing special here.

Ok this game is amazing, I think the story it told was great and the new gravity gun was sweet. The game is in 4 chapters and is too short which is the only down side to this game. The game is a bit confusing at times but with a bit of brain work you can figure it out. This game made me feel emotions, like sadness when it ended. I feel that if the game had a bit more chapters and some more dialoge in it then it would be a solid 10/10 but I give the game a 9.5/10
short n sweet, no jumpscares but its pretty spookyier elementamint

I am not recommending this game because of technical issues.  So I tried to play the game, I am a big fan of HL and I was hyped for it and after some minutes of gameplay I thought I'd crank down the settings because I don't have the best computer and it was lagging. After I changes the settings the framerate immediately tanked down and it was absolutely unplayable. I tried changing it back or to the lowest settings or restarting but nothing worked.

'The story takes place at a mysterious date & location. Where are you? Why have you been sent?'  This game/mod is by no means a bad game especially when it's free2play.  But other than the HL2 nostalgia, I find no point in playing it and complete it in 1.5 hours when there is absolutely no back-story at all.  I am disappointed to find the ending delivering nothing about the story, except nostalgia. It could be so awesome if it has some sort of story-telling (there seemed to be some story clue/hint throughout the game at some point.)

Attractive, well-made Half Life 2 mod which will give you 1-2 hours extra HL gameplay - never a bad thing. It seems to be down to the modding community to continue the Half Life experience now, as Valve seem to have given up long ago; this particular episode is compact but fun and action-packed.  A shout out in particular to the design of the environments, which is suitably dark and gritty just as City17 and Ravenholm were at their very best moments (plus some wonderfully moody lighting in places) and the new 'gravity cannon' which is especially satisfying to use.  The main detractors would be the short completion time and the lack of any real plot or purpose - a vague backstory is alluded to, but never really built on or made the most of. It's also not going to win many awards for originality (besides the new weapon) as it's the standard trawl through familiar crumbling urban environments battling Combine and zombies. It's a free mod though, so there's little reason not to pick up and play and lose an enjoyable couple of hours to Half Life once again.

Enjoyable to play, and without the sugarcoating (you don't get many hints, and that alone is praise worthy). I have little to complain aside from the controller (xbone) not fully switching between all weapons (not hing a quick spin of the mousewheel can't fix). The music is good, enemies are interesting, and the usage of the gravity-gun seems only limited to the users imagination.   TLDR: a fun playthrough that I'd recommend.
A handful of bugs but very entertaining

This game is amazing. It is really fun and added a lot of new elements that I could never have imagined. It's not very long but in that short amount of gameplay, there are a lot of puzzles that will stump you as well as some things you probably never thought of. I'm really hoping more is added to this game because it sorta feels incomplete. Overall, this game is just awesome and I really hope you check it out. Sidenote by the way, you should play Half-Life 2 and Half-Life Episode 1 to understand what's going on Pros: awesome Cons: not Half-Life 3 (GabeN pls)
TE120 is a small but great game. I would gladly pay 5 to 10 â‚¬ for This masterpiece. Just go ahead and play it. You Wont regret it.

Very short but also very fun. Transmissions Element 120 is a Half-Life 2 mini episode where you have to fight many enemies from HL2 and both episodes.   The game is not much different from HL2 but it also brings some new ideas like a new sort of gravity gun and small puzzles. And the final moments are actually better than in HL2 and Episode 1 (HL2 Episode 1 not that â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ movie from 1999 which ruined a whole franchise).   The only problem I have with this game are the framedrops. In an area with many lights and objects it runs very smooth with +144fps and in a corridor it drops to 50fps. Nothing gamebreaking but still strange.   If you like HL2 then go ahead and play this game, it is really good.
If you liked Half Life 2 then you'll enjoy this short but well made game. It's free so what's there to lose?!

Short, but awesome. It's nice to have something that reminds us all why we love the Half-Life series, even if it's a fan made mod. Still worth a play. My only wish for it is that it was a bit longer, and that the horror sections were expanded upon.
Only complaint is that I want more. Gravity jumping is a blast.

It's fun. Short, takes less than an hour to beat. It has major performanced issues, but this is really due to the Source Engiens age.  It fits the Half-Life style, but it has no beginning and no real end. It's a fun little mod, don't expect anything deep.

Ah, Half-Life, this game makes me pine for some more Gordon. The game overall was excellent with good map layout and skin design. It was fast paced; keeping you wondering what's around the next corner. I tip my hat to the developers who put this wonderful game out for free.

Pretty Great but [SPOILERS] ahead:     ...  The pacing between puzzles/fights and combines/zombies was a little bit iffy, it was just all puzzles and then just all fighting, same with the combies to zombies ratio as it was just all zombies and then combines and apart from the pacing issues the big battles between the zombies and combine seemed to have gone on a little bit longer than they should have but this is most likely due to compensate for the lack of pacing.  The maps and environment are very well made though, the world is populated with many varying props and enviromental hazards you can use to help with the fights and provide a change of pace during the exhausting fights.  The custom weapon(s) are very creative and the gravity jump mechanic was so much fun to use in the final battle on the striders, using it to catapult myself all of the place and over the roof tops and in general just for basic movement purposes.  Overall I really enjoyed my stay in this game and I found it very entertaining and well made. Thanks to everyone envolved!
Feels just like a lost chapter of HL2. Atmospheric, a couple of great combat encounters, great new gravity gun. Very Short and sweet.

Do i commonly right reviews? No, i do not, but i wanted to give a bit of an attention to the devs and tell something about this game to the one who reads this.  This game is certainly one to be called 'Short but sweet', Transmissions:Element 120 is a known, a HL2 modification that takes place in an unknown city, the player has to traverse the incredibly 'Alive' levels and under alive i mean, levels that will make one truly believe that someone lived, fought, died there, doing something. The game also adds a new weapon, i won't spoil it, but its awesome, adds a very interesting piece of AI to zombies (ONe that blew my mind), the music is fitting in every place, addind to the perfectly crafted and detailed atmosphere. So, what are its good sides. - High details, every scene tellig its sad story - Ai, tweaks to balance or add realism - New additions to the scenedry like bar codes, new graffities etc. - Interesting puzzles that do not require one to wrek his mind to solve. - A lot of breakable props, openable doors and so on  And its bad sides are...Typical half life Shinanigans that came from the release of it...and eye-hurtingly dark, i'm writing this the moment i finished playing the last level, it is incredibly dark.  TE120 is an incredibly atmospheric game, one must have a lot of curiosity and test out their ideas to find hidden items, loot, etc. Look for drawings and bar codes az they help out a lot. So don't be shy to test out your theories about somehting. This can't be considered a horror game, but its no less good. If you look for said category, turn back, but if you want to immerse yourslef into the dead city, filled by echoes of the past and bodies of ones who wanted freeom...This is a game for you  Developer, thank you for making me spend these 1.4 hours of my life and be incredibly satisfyied with it. The ending is a cliff hanger BTW, so i think the sequel should come out. OH OH AND IT HAS FULL CONTROLLER SUPPORT, i CHECKED

Right off the bat and pretty obviously - This Game NEEDS to be longer! Just look at all the reviewer's gametime, despite it being around 1hour average *We Have ALL Finished The Game*.  What makes this game so brilliant is how nostalgic it makes its Audience feel, this isn't some knockoff Half-Life 2 mod were you're doing random junk on the acclaim that the G-Man has let Gordan Freeman take the day off, this game managed to replicate the atmosphere and pacing that the Half-Life series did so well and of coarse the Concussion Gun was such a brilliant addition that I felt HL2 should utilise it.
this game is SO GOOD!!! I loved every single second of it :)

Being able to essentially rocket jump around with a map that has no clipping and is very open and well designed is so satisfying. Even though this mod is only four short chapters, I would gladly throw a couple bucks at this  essential  game.  The levels are well designed and have absolutely excellent flow. Even at the parts that were back tracking, I didn't feel like I was labourously retracking my steps. This is how game levels should be.  The jumping mechanic is extremely satisfying - it feels almost like im playing the Soldier from TF2.
Short but very, very well made.  It was nice to step back into the Half-Life world.
ok this game its short but i like it :3  just like the music from chapter 2
Excellent game - arena's are fantastic. Gave me a smile - reminicent of the original.

This mod is one of the most, well-done mods of the Half-life two modding community in my opinion.  It only took about, 50 miniutes to complete but it was a blast playing it, and I only died once during the short four chapters of the mod, on the last chapter which is god damn hard.  I would get this, since you dont need alot of great specs and just need HL2,  But, it's short as hell, leaving the consumers wanting more. The best suggestion is, update this or make sequels. The action sequences are few and its mainly a small puzzle-shooter mod, but it feels like its a legitimate Half Life game, And the small team did well doing so.  8/10.
Is a fantastic game but top short.

Had a great atmosphere that gave me the same tension as I did when I first played Half-Life 2. Transmission also added some new concepts and did a good job of easing the player into them. The enviroment is well-detailed and does a good job avoiding dead-space and the layout is well designed, guiding you forward while not being obnoxious and still allowing the oppurtunity to explore. Transmission makes me glad the Half-Life 2 modding isn't as dead as I thought it was, and I'm glad there still talented people working in it.

Really great mod. The gravity gun now uses your auxiliary energy to shoot something akin to a rocket which you can use to jump. It's fun to bounce around with it but the game is very short so you only get to utilize the skill in one or two firefights. Other than that you can snoop around in sewer tunnels for a bit using florescent markers that appear when you turn your flashlight off.   Check it out, it's free.
Great game

The game is pretty good, nice mechanics with the gun and I really liked the zombie mechanic as well! Problem is: it's too short =(. The ending is also a bit.... meh. Anyway hope that Element 121 is bigger than 1h =) Keep it coming!
Amazing. Super short, BUT IT'S FREE. Very well done game with interesting challenges/achievements.

Excellent mod. Very nice level design and some new twists on the standard Half-Life 2 gameplay. It's short, but from my own experience modding and mapping, it's pretty long for just a few guys working on it. It has the quality, but doesn't burn itself out by being too long.

I'd say if you're familiar with HL, the mod's length is about 20 mins. The mod brings some new mechanics into the game, which definitely makes it worth a try and the level design is just pure gold.      The best gravity gun i've ever used by far
Another great half life mod, it's very short with only 4 levels. The game is also rather easy and you kill almost everything with the gravity gun.  ..l., Gaben  9/10

Half-Life fans need to play this immediately.   You may not get to play as Gordon Freeman or see any familiar charactersâ€¦ but youâ€™ll see plenty of combine enemies and crab heads. Youâ€™ll even get to use a modified version of the gravity gun giving the nameless player the ability to â€œrocket jumpâ€ to solve puzzles and escape enemies. The puzzle solving is definitely unique to â€œHalf-Lifeâ€ adding a stealth element allowing the player to sneak past enemies in the dark if they choose. There are two wonderfully setup climax battles in the middle of the campaign and the end- which by the end will leave you wanting more. Much more.

I just beat this game and I have to say, for a free to play experience, this was very enjoyable. Short and sweet campaign that doesnt particularly force a oath down your throat, its up to you to find the way (more or less). Definetly worth the download. Expect 1 to 2 hours of gameplay for your first runthrough. The end battle might take a few tries, as for me it was unclear what to do, and took some trial and error. 8/10. Only thing I would've liked to see, was a bit more story, other than that, great game.
good. need more. please?
Its short, But is a great mod! The main weapon could be use in some other valve game :D 10/10
10/10 Happy. He do this mod for his wife!
This is one of the best souce mods I've seen. Very different mechanics that I'm used to such as glow-in-the-dark paint, shadow stealth, and qr codes. Also this game is VERY pretty.

Holy crap this is so cool, but super short. I assume you're just using this as a demo, but if you're not this is really just kind of disappointing. This took me .7 hours to complete, so if this is the final product it's a bit underwhelming, but still ambitious and fun. The gravity gun in this is really cool and could make for some really interesting platforming segments if you use it in a bigger project. I also like what you did with the zombies, it was pretty cool and I am very curious to how you did it. Did you actually script it to work with the lights or did you have it just coincide with flipping the switches to turn the lights off? Either way, it was pretty cool. The destruction is also pretty cool and looks really nice, especially when you're in the fight with the strider and it uses it's laser to destroy a huge chunk of the building you're in. The mechanics in this are really cool and fun, but in my opinion this game doesn't show what they're truly capable of. I hope this is just meant to be a demo, because this is brimming with potential.
step 1. ignore the negative reviews  step 2. enjoy the game   step 3. ignore reviews that say 'MY GAME KEEPS CRASHING'(they are probobly 7)  step 4. f*** s*** up

Some people say it is a bit short for them to enjoy. I disagree because even though it only has four chapters, it is an interesting story of a person who has been seperated from a resistance group against the combine forces. In fact, right as you get the crowbar, a scanner appears and you can destroy it if you want to. Later on you get an interesting weapon that acts similar to a rocket launcher in the fact that it shoots a powerful projectile that explodes on contact with anything, and allows you to blast jump (kinda), but the main upside of it is: it does not hurt you at all (excluding fall damage), and technically has infinite ammo. Downside is: it takes auxilary power, which is what you need to sprint to escape from any dangers you cannot handle, and the amount used per shot is about 20-25%, meaning you only have about 5 shots before you cannot use it. Thankfully auxilary power regenerates somewhat quickly. At the end of the whole thing, you have a decently large battle against some combine troops, including some of the more powerful ones which can only be killed with rocket launchers. To aid in this battle, the rooftops and the shed have rocket ammo on(in) them, which can be picked up at any time. I hope this review was helpful to those who are doubtful of this small but interesting game. If you are still skeptic, or want to try it for yourself, go ahead.
Needs to be included with Valve's next Half-Life game (If it comes out)
Theres something about the half life engine that simply makes me enjoy the game.

Great graphics, however this game can run on even the worst of computers. Really fun combat and weapons! It's basically another short Half-Life game, plus, it's free! so definitely give this game a try.

A nearly perfect chapter in the Half-Life universe that is innovative in design. New mechanics using light and power, a fun new tool/weapon, and clever puzzles make this a great reminder what talented modders can create with the Source engine.
Short but very fun. The final battle was a little exploitative but overall a great mod.
Last stage is well designed. One of the most enjoyable map in half life series and mods.

One thing that I don't like when I play games is when it does not have objectives. In Transmissions: Element 120, you fight some zombies, Combine soldiers and Stiders, then you win. Keyword: Survival.  But, since it is relatable to Half-Life series, who cares?   The good side is the environment is pretty great to look at and I love the fight scene in Chapter 2. Although this game is short, it is satisfying to complete the achievements.   I do not like the abrupt ending though and was actually expecting some human conversation in this game. Nevertheless, I look forward for the developers to expand the storyline in the next game.   So, for players who love Half-Life, do not miss the chance to play this amazing free game.
You see, Valve? Do you? Do you really? THIS is how it's done. This is what we want. More. Just that.
Good mod, great concept, story is lacking (either that or too implied for me to see it). 7.5/10

A great little game running on the source engine, has the same feeling and responsiveness like in the previouse Half life games, and introduces a new mechanic with the gravity gun! Only difference is that it has a more atmospheric/horror tone to it. The only real negative is that it's painfully short. But apart from that, it has some real promise for the future. I hope the develeper of the game contiunes this project!
Actually pretty good
Do you ever wanted rocket jumping in half-life? If the answer is yes, then i recommend this game

An absolutely amazing free game for fans of the Half-Life, with new guns and new ways to get around that enrich the game experience. The only downside to it is the length of the game, it is fairly shot only about 3 hours long if you go right through it without seeing all the secrets and without getting all the achievements. I would rate it a 9/10 just because the game was not that long but other than that an amazing game (please make another one)
Could use less of those terrifying poison headcrabs but other than that really fun.

A unique approach for the well-known storyline of Half-life 2's doomed City 17, featuring a new type of experimental kinetic weapon and light/darkness related puzzles that work surprisingly well. If you like the Half-Life series, you really should try out this piece. Now i'm very interested in seeing a fully written background story and a standalone game based on this experience. Sadly it's somewhat short, but compensates with great quality.

This game has some cool mechanics (new Gravity gun, fluorescent Paint, QR-Codes, etc) , some nice riddles and cool secrets. The 'boss'-fight was very fun to play. I was a bit astounded that it was so short, but it's a free mod, so im ok with it. If you're a HL-fan like me, definetly recommended. :)
Great and waaaayyy too short of a mod! I JUST WANT MORE!
tried it for a few minutes when i downloaded it, looks liek a keeper

Some minor flaws, but this is a game easily worth a few bucks. Fans of Half Life: 2 will love this, and even those who have never played a Half Life game will enjoy this. This is a very interesting game, and whilst the final battle may be tedious, it's still a fun little game that should take 1-2.5 hours to complete.
Its Fun but i need more
Short, sweet, and fun! Thanks!
this is half-life 3 for me
Expected it to be a bit longer, but I definitely recommend it. the final fight is pretty cool. it's a great concept and i wish that the author had taken it further.
short but fun
I gotta say pretty cool game even though it is HALF made :D

STOP READING THIS RIGHT NOW AND GET THE GAME! Nah jokes, it was a great game in all aspects. I found very few things wrong and the game is awesome! I'd like to see a sequel to this Mod, as it was so good. Maybe, if we do somehow see a sequel in the future, you could make it a bit longer? Anyways the game is great, definitely get it.
Fun on the free, what's not to like? Graphics update is decent, and the action is good.

A very, very amazing game. Excellent Graphics and FPS. It has an epic horror feel to it throughout the game and a line that is fully persistant during the game as well: ' They can't see in the dark either '  10/10. AwesomeWork.
it was short but i enjoyed whatever there was. hopefully someone will make maps for this game

Great little mod, really enjoyed playing it! Features several unique puzzles and and challenges, with the addition of the modifiied gravity gun and many destroyable houses that leads to a unique and challenging conclusion! Would love to see this bloom into something larger!

Amazing short experiance honestly an entire game can be based around the concept of the gravity jump here.  The concept they used is basically rocket jumping but it's used in all the right ways buildings that you can jump from one to another and fights based around the ability to push objects though they do introduce a mechanic where turrets/zombies can't see in the dark and I wish they could mae more stuff like that being in a dark room filled with zombies to fulfill an objective is AWESOME. Highly reccommend this it might be short but it does everything right.
still better than infinate warfare
Good and short game!
Didnt expect it is THAT short. Its a good though
Very fun, and in a great style. But way too short, i only wish there was more.
This scratched my Half-Life2 itch a bit.   Atmosphere was fantastic and there are a few features in this that are quite clever and really enjoyed.
Neat and refreshing HL2 mod. Could be longer, but for it's length and new content it's definitely a mod to remember.
Worth playing.

This is kind of incredible. If you still burn a candle waiting for Half-Life 3, you owe it to yourself to give Element 120 here a try, because it's as creative and polished as any of Valve's work. I've played through it twice now (once when it was a mod, and now again for the Steam release) and I love it.  The only thing I don't like about it is that it has to end. Depending on how quickly you pick up on what to do and where to go, this will last you somewhere in the realm of 20 minutes to maybe an hour. I was hoping the Steam release would add a little more content to poke around in, but alas. Right when you feel confident in your abilities, the credits roll.  Excited to see if this dev has any other games or anything planned for the future. Until then, play this.
Short, but fun. Lack of direction, for better and for worse.

Transmissions: Element 120... this is something different. This game is just marvelouse, despite its short length (then again, its free). This entire mini-game had the full half-life feeling and i enjoyed from the start to the finish. I'd love for it to be a little longer.    Must play 10/10

What do I need to say? A Half-Life: 2 Adventure set in the Half-Life: 2 universe for free. This could've just been a chapter from the original game. It's simply a very well thought out game. I really enjoyed it, even though the game was short.

This is more of the Half Life Universe that I love including some new puzzles, some new features and some new devices. I won't say much more than that but this is GREAT. Thanks for creating this new content!  Okay - second go around with the review. This experience is somewhat short but highly detailed. I was stumped for the period of a few moments in several of the puzzles but not enough to become frustrated or disinterested at all.  If you liked all of the HL games and are wanting something to play for an hour or so this is for you!
this was very fun to play and i cant wait if you are going to make another one and the gun i cant wait for someone to make it in Gmod Good Job!
tooo short loved it

Very short but highly enjoyable and free adventure in the Half-Life 2 universe. Levels are well designed and the custom music fits perfectly with the already known score from Half-Life 2. Most notably the gravity gun has been altered a little bit and can now be used to launch deadly projectiles that can send enemies flying, but can also be utilised like a catapult for the player to reach higher places.  Give it a try :)

Great original idea, really short game (completed it in an hour) but so great. starts of with some great puzzles an light stealth elements which is a nice intro, but the last fight was great.    Using the new gravity gun to jump around on top of buildings while fighting striders and combine while walls are being blown up and you are scrambling around to find more rockets to damage the striders    was an unique experience. it added rocketjumping to the fast paced combat of half-life 2 making it an even more thrilling experience. Sadly the game is really short and i would love to see these ideas (the stealth and the rocketjumper gravitygun) back in a bigger mod or even a standalone game. This mod is so worth your time, its free. just download it right away.

I played this game briefly, it's very well designed, certainly works for a Half Life addition. The problem I felt was that some areas weren't that well put together and you would load a screen but have nowhere to go. This happened several times during my play though.   Despite this, if you love Half Life and you're looking for a cool addition to the game, give this a go, it's fairly well designed.
It's a pretty good short game set in a dark atmosphere. Recommended for everyone who wants Half-Life 3. Definitely a filler.
REALLY FUN FINALE!!! Shoot with or without tactics! Great game!
'Where are you? Why have you been sent?' - The game's description. Played the game, still not sure. 10/10 Would aimlessly wonder around and kill zombies again.
Very good game, love the concept! Wish there was more gameplay.
I paid for games not as good as this one. Would pay for it. Great little game.

This game is the very definition of 'Short but sweet'. It's not very long, which is a bit of a bummer, but man, the quality more than makes up for it.   9.5/10, I had some problems solving the puzzle in the sealed dark room with two ambushing turrets.
WARNING SPOILERS!!!!! The game is pretty short and all but its really fun the last bit of the game is hard and boring but it still is very fun with element 120 I LOVE BOUNCING IN THE GAME WITH IT!!!
That was a lot of fun! Loved the levels and gameplay. Brings back memories of hl2 when it first came out :)
Very fun, short experience. If it extended to at least 10 hours, I'd buy it on the cheap. 15+ would maybe be full price, if it's not too expensive.
Quite short, but an exciting romp through the familiar world of City 13. Level design is superb, and the new mechanics are quite fun.

A great mod for Half Life players!  For a free game & mod, this short game brings the Half Life experience you wanted. It's free, easy 100% achievements, and it brings a great nostalgic feel to your playing. It has that HL vibe into it, and the immersion where the little ambient horror exist is there. What's new and amazing is the new form of the gravity gun. New minor parts such as glow-in-the-dark writing & the sentries add a new challenge to players. Overall, the creator did a fantastic job. The game did felt a bit too easy, but it's only a ~1 hour game. It did left you wanting more, so CREATOR PLZ MORE!  Rating: 9/10 (ITS FREE, JUST GET IT!)
this game dank/10 get it. Fun, free2play, and set in the half life universe. What else do you want?
i loved the game
Good hour long mod. the new weapon is brilliant. mechanics with the dark are well thought out
Very atmospheric mod. Zombies doesn't see in the dark trick is genious
Very short but amazing #3 REALLY needs to come out.
You should download it! Its a good game!
The best hl2 mod i've ever played, it's a masterpiece!  What you waiting for? play it!

this game was an amazing game, i always enjoy HL2 mods. This one was with a twist. i liked how many new things were introduced like the glow in the dark signs, the graffitti QR codes, containers, etc...   at first the last level seemed tricky    standing off striders, but once you realize you can go 'roof-top'   you start enjoying it more and more.  played 4 times already!
Accidently pressed F instead of E in a pit full of zombies.  8/10, would make mistakes again.
Great little game to play your'e starving for more Half-Life. Highly recommended.
It is short (a couple of hours) game, but it was nice to remember Half-Life 2 atmosphere.
Necessito mas. Emulates Half life 2 while the designer added an inventive new tool and other interesting features. Will not spoil, must play for Half Life fans.

Short but an amazing game worthy to use half life universe for its own story. Great atmosphere and the new mechanics felt as if they had always been a part of the HL-franchise. Ondly downside for me would be the shortness of the game but for f2p title this was totally a 10/10 experience.
This was a great mod/add on/whatever. The only fault was that it was so short.
It got really interesting concepts, i like it.  The mod/game is good and It's free, so what's not to like?
really nice mod, very well planned, perfect atmosphere. if you sell a game like this I would buy it.

One of the more interesting HL2 mods I've played in a while. Brings new gameplay mechanics such as night blinded zombies and of course the intersting twist on the gravity gun. My only complaint with it was that it was just too short.
This is a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing beautiful game. This tops any community made half life campaigns I've ever seen. Keep up the amazing work.
Half life 3 is way too short.

Simply great! Very short, but very original mod, with some new gameplay elements and a new spin on the gravity gun. I remember zombies being a lot more threatening in Half-Life 2, though, and the ending felt too abrupt. Still, definitely worth playing!

This is a great mod. It's not too long; about 1 hour. It does have some horror parts but not to many, still the atmosphere almost always makes it feel at least a little horrific. It does have some achievements that can be obtained easily along the way.
This game is HL3. All of its beauty... all of its... ITS A DAMN GOOD GAME. And its free!?  THIS IS A SHORT GAME WORTH 10$ FOR â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥S SAKE, JUST GET IT. Thank you.

Really amazing but unfortunately short single player experience. I really like the dark atmosphere of Half Life universe. It really looks like something created by Valve. It's all made by just one talented guy. Nicely done level design too. And it's for free.  I want play more stuff from this awesome guy.   Final verdict: 4/5
The Game's short. But what can I say, it's free!

The game is really short, but its worth playing! Really well made levels with puzzels and action. Most importantly a new type of gravity gun for 'Rocket jumping' i guess this time its 'Graviry jumping'.
This game take FPS and creativity in a great way and I love it. Honestly I love blowing up things with the huge gun thing that I got! Amazing game, I recomend greatly!
Nice game!
Lets be honest...          Its Half Life 3
You can beat it in less than an hour, but it's still fun.
Its Was Great, Love it
Fun mini-episode in the half-life universe. It's free and worth every cent :)

Pretty short experience, but the concept of a rocket jump based weapon is really intressting. You should create a expansion or something since the game isnt really that long, and with the gameplay aspects that this mod has, a full lenght game would be a amazing experience.   9 / 10 - Great Atmoshpere, Good gameplay

Holy â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. This game is amazing. The second it ended, I got into an instant state of depression because I wanted more. I can't even explain how great this is. Though the gravity gun isn't in it, it's replacement is so much fun to use and I can definitely see it being in a Half-Life game. The addition of stealth was perfect. I definitely recommend this game to people who love the Half-Life series.
If you're a Half life fan just try it out okay. It is reeeally short, but a lot of fun and actually fits well in the Half life universe. And also its free so... why not, right???

This game is most enjoyable it is a little shot but it makes up in little moments like watching some dudes get destroyed by zombies and head crabs XD this game was quite fun to play and ill give it a 9/10 because of the lengh of the game couldve been longer
A DLC worth playing,didn't deviate from its genre
I need more!!!!!

This brief game, fan-made, is pretty good. There was some new music, a great story (though short), and a lot of suspense. It had a nice 'portal' mentality as the user figures out how to use Element 120. It's about as long to play as Half Life: Lost Coast - I would need to sit down and time them to be sure of the difference. But very enjoyable and a nice challenge. I would recommend without question. Even if it were sold (for, say $5-8) I would be willing to purchase it.  Well done, Creator. Well done.
this is a game that brings back the memory of hl2, so its good. 1 hour is short thoug, we need more!  8/10 - needs more gameplay!
An amazingly clean game. Had many moments where I was wowed by beautiful level design and interesting new concepts. Well worth a playthrough of this short but sweet campaign.

This game is like an additional level or two to Half-Life 2. It brings the same mix of physics puzzles and gunplay. However it has a few gameplay changes. The biggest one is that you can â€œrocketâ€ jump with the gravity gun â€“ pretty cool. The graphics are good; I liked the outdoor sections very much. The achievements are easy to get but if you are not prepared youâ€™ll probably need to beat the game twice (which is not bad at all).  It is a real treat that we can have this for free.
I was really pleased with this game, really creates darker feel and ambience of surrounding that was plentiful in Half Life 2 .

Transmissions: Element 120  is a free, small  Half-Life 2  mod/game that takes about an hour to complete with easy achievements. It comes with a modified zero point energy field manipulator (gravity gun), great level design, and more experience playing in the  Source  engine.  Transmissions: Element 120  is great for fans of the  Half-Life  series who are looking for more content. Easily recommended - no complaints here.
Great fun playing a Half Life game again! Thank you to the developers!
Short. Fun. But everything i wanted to interact with was not interactable. no wall breaks for me only the striders.
Awesome. Brings back memories from half life and portal. Loved it. Major respect to the developers!
Pleasured me enough ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°)

One of the most atmospheric games I've played in my life. A bit shorter than I had hoped it would be, but for a free mod, it was absolutely fantastic. If you're a fan of Half Life, you'll love Transmissions.

Awesome little game! The enhanced gravity gun is really awesome :D Relatively short game, I finished it in 45 minutes, but since it's free, I'd absolutely recommend giving it a try. I'd also recommend playing Half Life 2 before this game though.

Transmissions: ELement 120 is a short custom Half Life 2 game. I like the unique take on the gravity gun and the levels are fun and challenging. This is much more fun than The Lost Cost and well worth the price of FREE.  Good work to the developer and thanks for the fun.

This game was very fun to play. The new gameplay element was great. However I think the strider battle was abit tedious. The fact this game is 100% free is also great if you like Half-Life 2 at all I recommend this game.  7.5/10   Will play again.
this is well...great. the light is great, Story great, Weopon great, physics great. You did A good job for half-life 2

9/10 Love it but I crave more!  The feeling of flying over striders to your impending doom is terrifying but exhilarating at the same time. I love the concept and the use of the gravity gun to rocket jump across the gaps and people. I love the dark theme and the music! Encore!
